title: How to Make Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Truffles

steps.headline: Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper or spray it with baking oil.
Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy.
Fold in the flour and add the milk.
steps.description: Blend on low speed until the cookie dough holds together and there are no flour streaks.

steps.headline: Add in the chocolate chips and walnuts if desired.
Form the balls.
steps.description: Grab a piece of the cookie dough and shape it into a 1 inch ball. Place it on the baking sheet. Repeat until there is no more cookie dough.

steps.headline: Let the cookie dough balls chill for about 1-2 hours until they are firm.
Melt the chocolate candy coating in a microwave-safe bowl.
steps.description: Every thirty seconds, mix the chocolate with a spoon to prevent it from scorching. Repeat until the chocolate fully melts and is smooth.

steps.headline: Allow the melted chocolate to cool for about 5 minutes.
Dip the cookie balls into the melted chocolate until fully coated.
steps.description: Drop the cookie dough balls into the bowl and roll it around with a spoon. Allow any excess chocolate to drip off from the truffles.

steps.headline: Place the truffles on the baking sheet.
Chill the truffles for about 15 minutes, until the chocolate hardens and the truffles are firm.
Serve.
steps.description: Remove the truffles from the fridge and place them on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy!

text: Cover a baking sheet with parchment paper or spray it with baking oil.  Cream the butter and sugar in a large bowl until light and fluffy.  Pour in the vanilla extract.  Fold in the flour and add the milk. Blend on low speed until the cookie dough holds together and there are no flour streaks. Add in the chocolate chips and walnuts if desired.  Form the balls. Grab a piece of the cookie dough and shape it into a 1 inch ball. Place it on the baking sheet. Repeat until there is no more cookie dough. Let the cookie dough balls chill for about 1-2 hours until they are firm.  Melt the chocolate candy coating in a microwave-safe bowl. Every thirty seconds, mix the chocolate with a spoon to prevent it from scorching. Repeat until the chocolate fully melts and is smooth. Allow the melted chocolate to cool for about 5 minutes.  Dip the cookie balls into the melted chocolate until fully coated. Drop the cookie dough balls into the bowl and roll it around with a spoon. Allow any excess chocolate to drip off from the truffles. Place the truffles on the baking sheet.  Chill the truffles for about 15 minutes, until the chocolate hardens and the truffles are firm.  Serve. Remove the truffles from the fridge and place them on a serving plate. Serve with a glass of milk if desired. Enjoy!
